text: And finally niche twitter philosophy channels, a mixture of people who know Plato through Wikipedia, Hegel through literal footnotes in some fancy continental phil. book or Kant through memes. It's more like a madhouse at this point.

3/4 Then the senior philosophers, usually white European male philosophers in their 60s+, reminding everyone that they figured it all out so no need for a younger generation as long as they are not their protegees. A whole tribe of vain and increasingly irrelevant philosophers.

2/4Then after the so-called outsiders who can't even see they are merely dabbling in bad philosophy, there are the 'overambitious' graduate students or young academics, a cutthroat bunch who is too lazy and too impatient to learn something before selling their fellow philosophers

1/4 One of the most defining characteristics of philosophy today is the amount of vitriol it receives and the amount of toxic fume it generates in itself. Like some pigheaded scientist bashes philosophy and then has no problem making a mystical comment about nature, cause science
